means: 是…的特征( characterize的过去式和过去分词 )
使…具有特点（或最引人注目的特征）

sentence.Network_en: Daniel's few encounters with Gold had been characterized by a laboured politeness.
sentence.Network_cn: 丹尼尔与戈尔德的几次碰面都只是虚礼客套一番。

sentence.Network_en: This election campaign has been characterized by violence.
sentence.Network_cn: 暴力行为已成为这次竞选活动的一大特点。

sentence.Network_en: Both companies have characterized the relationship as friendly.
sentence.Network_cn: 两家公司都认为彼此之间关系友好。

PerfectNetExp.abs: an abnormal condition of pregnancy characterized by hypertension and edema and proteinthe urine ., 孕期的一种异常状态特征是高血压和水浮肿.
This product is characterized by low expansion coefficient , high refractoriness , good thermal and chemical stability ., 本产品特点是膨胀系数小 , 耐火度高 , 热化学稳定性好.
A mental disorder characterized by severe depression , apathy , and withdrawal., 忧郁症以极度意志消沉 , 无兴趣及逃避现实为特征的一种精神病.
Huaba land use system characterized by " three-channel for irrigation . -- unpaid , duration , no movement . "划拔土地使用制度的特点是“三无?埂?――无偿、无期限、无流动。

list.abs: 风险描述（risk characterization）：根据危害识别、危害描述和暴露评估，对某一给定人群的已知或潜在健康不良效果的发生可能性 …
通讯专业... ... characteristic white 特征白色 characterization test 鉴定测试 character-oriented procedure 面向字符的规程.
...signal amplitude sequencing control,信号幅值顺序控制signal characterizer,信号表征器signal common,信号公共线
characteristic-integration 特征积分characterization factor 特性因数characterization 表征

entry.def: If something is characterized by a particular feature or quality, that feature or quality is an obvious part of it.

example.ex: This election campaign has been characterized by violence...
example.tran: 暴力行为已成为这次竞选活动的一大特点。

example.ex: A bold use of colour characterizes the bedroom.
example.tran: 这间卧室的特点是用色大胆。

entry.def: If you characterize someone or something as a particular thing, you describe them as that thing.

example.ex: Both companies have characterized the relationship as friendly...
example.tran: 两家公司都认为彼此之间关系友好。

example.ex: This play is characterized as a comedy.

means.word_mean: 1. of the meaning of words or concepts; stated precisely

auth_sentence.content: Their products are sufficiently well characterized to be distinctive.
auth_sentence.res_content: Their products are sufficiently well characterized to be distinctive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Their products are sufficiently well characterized to be distinctive.

auth_sentence.content: That enchanting play of fancy which had once characterized her.
auth_sentence.res_content: That enchanting play of fancy which had once characterized her.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That enchanting play of fancy which had once characterized her.

auth_sentence.content: Frequently characterized as an exacting conductor...Evans has since become alarmingly laissez-faire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Frequently characterized as an exacting conductor...Evans has since become alarmingly laissez-faire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Frequently characterized as an exacting conductor...Evans has since become alarmingly laissez-faire.

Sentence.sentence: Under these circumstances, it's natural to look for what may appear to be the most "practical" way out of the problem "Major in a subject designed to get you a job" seems the obvious answer to some, though this ignores the fact that many disciplines in the humanities characterized as "soft" often, in fact, lead to employment and success in the long run.
Disputes were characterized by intense verbal ( 言语上的) aggression, tended to be repeated and not resolved and made men, more than women, extremely angry.
